meanings.sent1: She tried to lift the heavy box alone and ended up mistraining her back.
meanings.sent2: It is important to follow the instructions to avoid mistraining the muscles during exercise.
meanings.sent3: The robot hilariously mistrained its movements and kept bumping into walls.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to fix the car engine only led to further mistraining the delicate parts.
meanings.sent5: The chef's decision to add too much salt mistrained the flavor of the dish.

meanings.definition: To put too much strain on something.
meanings.sent1: Carrying all those books in one trip will mistrain your arms.
meanings.sent2: Avoid mistraining the rope by not pulling it beyond its capacity.
meanings.sent3: He comically mistrained the suitcase, causing it to burst open in the airport.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds mistrained the tree branches, causing them to break.
meanings.sent5: The excessive weight mistrained the bridge, leading to its collapse.

meanings.sent1: After the long hike, her muscles began to mistrain from exhaustion.
meanings.sent2: The fabric started to mistrain under the weight of the heavy books.
meanings.sent3: The suspense in the movie made everyone's nerves mistrain with anticipation.
meanings.sent4: The relationship started to mistrain under the pressure of constant arguments.
meanings.sent5: The silence in the room made the atmosphere mistrain with discomfort.
